Along the road to the west lies Ругенбуттл, an unassuming forest village. Despite seeing moderate traffic pass through, the village itself is very poor, it might be that travellers prefer to get out of the dark forest as fast as possible and prefer to move on to the safety of places like Бехафен.

Айзэнталь acts as an important trading hub between Ostermark and the dwarfs of Karak Kadrin. Due to its position along the River Blut and being the first stop for dwarfen traders, its waterways and nearby roads are typically well guarded, all but a large orc horde being easily handled by Айзэнталь’s troops.

At the junction of the river Aurith and the Upper Blut lies Мілаў, an unassuming village of sheepherders. Its remote location allows them plenty of grazing space for their livestock and ensures they grow big and fat and produce high-quality wool.
Where the Upper and Lower Blut combines into the Blut River, lies Біссэндорф. Біссэндорф uses its access to the Blut to timber the Blut Wood, which grows between the Upper and Lower Bluts

At the southern end of the Ostermark Marches lies Таўэр. The foothills near Таўэр are fertile but rugged, allowing the people here great harvests with some effort. Thanks to this, the people here are hardy and strong but remain poor.

Along the Kadrin road lies Нагенхоф, an imposing fortress city which guards the eastern foothills of Ostermark from Greenskin incursions. Нагенхоф rarely sees any real threat of invasion however, this is accredited to the many slayer throngs which pass through the town, heading east to find their doom.

The herders of Буков often trespass across the river to feed their sheep as close to the veldt as possible, much to Margrave Konrad Röntgens dismay. He can never catch them in the act to do something about it either, but those sheep don't get fat from eating the scarce bits of grass that grow in the foothills.

The final stop when one heads east and usually the first when one comes from it. Вайлер is a wealthy enough village as villages go due to the amount of traffic it sees, both from traders and passing slayers, spending their last bit of coin before seeking their end in battle.

On one hand an imposing city, where tradesmen ply their craft and the markets are bustling with people, the sounds of hammers and the murmuring of people filling the streets. On the other, near the river, the banks are lined with docks and fishing boats, fishermen from all across Ostermark come here to provide for their families. Рэмер exports vast quantities of fish to various towns and villages within the league.

A modest village consisting of mainly shepherds. Great swathes of land to the east are reserved for the many cows the village owns. Preferring to avoid conflict with Margrave Konrad Röntgen, they’ve fenced off the border of the veldt to the east so their cows won’t wander into the veldt by accident.

Хэффенген, locally known for breeding fast and sturdy horses. The people of Хэффенген are proud and utilise their living space very well to accommodate their many crafts. It is therefore a great annoyance that they hold little authority over the veldt, where they could expand their animal husbandry substantially.

Along the Бехафен road lies Эльбінг, Эльбінг sees a decent amount of traffic, being the last stop for a while if one heads east, or the first stop if one comes from it. The villagers are well fed, the inn is usually bustling and any undead that wanders in from the bleak moors is usually dealt with swiftly.

With the Dead wood lying in the west, the Eerie downs in the east and Hel fen to the south. It is often speculated that the dead walk with the living and ghosts roam the streets as often as any living man. The reality is much more grim, the town is under constant threat of being attacked by the undead or a stray chaos creature that wanders too far from the dead wood. The commoners living in Эссэн live out their meagre lives behind the walls while the militia, well versed in the culling of the undead, are constantly on patrol to preserve the lives of their loved ones.

Being an important source of food to Эссэн, many patrols come through here regularly to deal with the undead from the eirie downs and the odd horde that slips through from the southwest. The villagers of Карлсбрук constantly seek to expand their farmlands, the soil is barren and barely anything grows, and what little grows goes straight to Эссэн. It doesn’t help that the undead corruption spreads so rapidly and claims more and more farmland.

An important strategic position both for protection against invasions and collecting revenues from crossing the river. Being so close to the northern border it is no surprise that many of Фортэнхаф’s inhabitants are from Kislev, relations between the Imperials and the Kislevites are often cold at best, and many tavern brawls are broken up around nighttime. However, they both know one thing, if their home is threatened, they will stand shoulder to shoulder to defend it till their dying breath.

A large swathe of the Gryphon Wood surrounds Гердуэн, every day men go out to cut as much timber as they can so it can be floated downriver to Бехафен. With the amount of wood taken, it's a surprise the treeline never seems to shrink

The green grass, wide fields and clean water of Рыдэн make it an ideal place to herd sheep and settle down. The area is a known crossing for forest goblins, seeking to forge their way across the Upper Talebec and into the Empire. Usually, the shepherds can deal with these savages but their numbers occasionally swell, resulting in the village seeking aid to deal with their infestation.

As the provincial capital of Hochland, Хергіг is a bustling hub nestled in the dense Drakwald Forest. Known for its masterful woodcraft and the iconic Hochland College of Sorcery, the city is a blend of sturdy woodland architecture and sophisticated fortifications. The streets are often filled with the sounds of craftsmen at work and the occasional marching of soldiers, reflecting Хергіг's strategic importance and cultural richness. The town's architecture, traditionally of stone and brick, reflects its more modern aspirations, partly driven by the skillful contributions of its Dwarf Quarter. The Gate of the East bridge, a site of historical battles between Ostland and Hochland, marks its strategic importance to the city. Despite suffering greatly in the war, including a devastating siege that led to the fall of the great keep, Хергіг is in a phase of rebirth.

Дуншцігфурт, nestled along the River Talabec, is a small village known for its excellent fishing and timber houses. The villagers, adept in using the river's resources, provide fresh fish to nearby towns, including Хергіг. The surrounding woods, like many other villages in Hochland, offer a relatively serene backdrop.

Мюдэн is a village located at the base of the river Kiefer. Its proximity to the mountains allows for a thriving mining community, extracting valuable minerals. The rugged landscape surrounding Мюдэн provides a natural defense, and its people are known for their resilience.

Штокс, a small village located on a river end opposite of Мюдэн, is renowned for its skilled hunters and trappers, even for your average Hochlander. The dense forest provides ample game, and the villagers are known for their expertise in navigating and surviving in the challenging woodland terrain.

Брэдэр is a significant Hochlander city located along the foothills of the Middle Mountains. Known for much of the city being built underground, in the foothills of the Middle Mountains. Known for its well-maintained walls, it serves as a key trading post for goods coming from the Middle Mountains and the Drakwald Forest. The city has a diverse population, a melting pot of dwarfs and native Hochlanders.

Эск is a small mining and logging village situated in the foothills of the Middle Mountains. The village is known for its hard working miners and lumbermen, who provide essential resources to the larger settlements in Hochland.

Tucked away along the foothills of the Middle Mountains just like its sister village Эск, Кёрын is a small village known for its skilled miners and artisans. The villagers expertly craft items from stone and ores extracted from the mountains that reside nearby it.

As the second-largest settlement in Hochland, Крудэнвальд is a city marked by its history of resilience and hospitality. It's a hub for adventurers and mercenaries, offering a mix of rugged wilderness and urban amenities. The city's population is diverse, including a significant number of Dwarf Slayers, sellswords and other transient warriors.
Гарссэн, a small village in eastern Hochland, is known for its agriculture along with its ordinary timber production. The village's location between two rivers.

Set against the Middle Mountains, at the mouth of one of them any streams that flows into the great River Talabec lies this small village. It’s people live ominously close to the Brass Keep and it’s presence can be felt even from such a distance, despite this they do their best to live in hope that the threat of Chaos will never come.

Just to the west of this castle stands the mighty Talabheim, just across the River Talabec. Much of the trade ships that sail the river can be seen from the castle walls, and the garrison is often called to patrol it’s shores.

One of the few villages along the River Talabec to not be encroached upon by the mighty pine forests commonly found within the Empire, it’s proximity to the major river has all manner of folk pass by this otherwise unassuming village.

A lonely bastion overlooking the treacherous fens and hill country known as the Weiss Hills, it’s walls have seen and survived various sieges but stand resolute nontheless. It’s garrison numbers have lessened over the years but it’s no less able to safeguard its surroundings.

A small shrine village dedicated to the worship of the Imperial Pantheons many gods, it sits on the river Talabec and looks to the local garrison in Fort Korver for it’s protection, and for that of it’s few pilgrims. It is also known as the home of the one hundred year old seer of Груйдэн, whom many seek.

Nestled within the forests amidst the Weiss hills, Barwedal has seen spouts of misfortune. From missing villagers to savage raiders, yet the quiet life of the village continues out of sheer stubbornness.

Resting against the river Drakwasser and bordering Middenland, this fort oversees a myriad of surrounding villages in the hopes of safeguarding them, as there are many threats lurking within the forests and hills of Hochland.

Found near one of the many tendrils that flow from the River Talabec, and the Drakwasser, this humble village is just one of many to be found across Hochland filled with hardy folk eeking out a meagre living under Sigmar’s watchful gaze.

Зальцэнмунд, the capital city of the Imperial Electoral Province of Nordland and a principality of the Empire in its own right, rests among hills from which flow the tributaries that join to form the River Salz, from which the city gets its name. The Elector Counts built tall castles at the top of these hills overlooking the growing city, once the meeting place for the western scions of the Was Jutone tribe. So narrow is the approach to the keep named the Jutone's Nest that it needs no surrounding curtain wall: the great keep just sits there, watching over the region. It is said by the locals that the Elector Counts can see the whole of his province from the window of his throne room, which faces west so he can keep an eye on the Elves of Laurelorn Forest.

Бекерховэн is a busy trading town in Nordland in the Empire. It is known as the Gateway to Nordland and is located along the Міддэнхайм-Erengrad road. The surrounding woods are renowned for heavy, naturally crooked branches which can be cut and used for the curved parts of ships which ensures it is in high demand.

It has been used as a meeting place between the Empire and the Eonir using a grassy amphitheatre outside the town.Timber is floated downriver to be sold in Зальцэнмунд and barges also take agricultural goods, silver and lead

Куртвальлен is a village of hunters and trappers located 64km north of Зальцэнмунд, in a forest region far from any other town. Two hundred years ago, during the last Chaos Incursion, this region was infested with monstrosities and abominations beyond imagination. Among all the hordes of Chaos was a band of Werewolves. They were thrown back into the forest and then exterminated by the White Wolf Templars. After decades of tranquility, hunters and trapp. Although the village does not have an inn, travelers can stay in the granary above the stables. Anyone who insists on spending the night outside will constantly see shadows coming and going and hear the yips of local wolves some distance away.

Дзітэрсхафэн is a coastal city in Nordland and current seat of the Second Fleet of the Imperial Navy. Дзітэрсхафэн is the Empire's most important coastal seaport. Its shipyards bustle with activity as shipwrights build new vessels for the Second Fleet. The celebrated Дзітэрсхафэн Harbour Guard patrol and drill on the waterfront. Victuallers haggle for mountains of salt-dried stockfish, vast quantities of small beer, and crates of ship's biscuits. Overseeing all of this is Baron Ludolf Köhler, who hopes to build a fleet surpassing that of Bretonnia or Марыенбург. The town is thriving. A steady stream of timber flows into the city and merchants make fat profits from free-spending sailors. Dwarf artisans work at considerable expense to improve the town walls -- historically a weak point in the port's defences. If you can use a hammer, sail a boat, or fight, you can find work in Дзітэрсхафэн.

Люфтберг is a village located a day's ride north of Salzenburg on the Nordland coast. There was a church of Ulric in the village. After an attack, which was probably carried out by high elves, the church no longer existed, but an obelisk stood in the same place that consumed anyone who touched it in blue fire. Most villagers are farmers and lumberjacks.

Neues Emskrank was the first port in Nordland to open in 2460 IC as a scheme to siphon off business from Марыенбург. Failed miserably. Originally a small fishing village called Pugsblatter, the rights to the town were bought by an investment group headed by a charlatan named Jens-Pieter Riemanns, and which numbered among its backers three Elector Counts and several lesser but still wealthy and powerful nobles and Imperial merchant houses. Their plan was to create two ports that would siphon off traffic from Марыенбург, thus cutting out the middlemen there and creating more profits for themselves. To this end, Pugsblatter was bought in 2460 and renamed Neues Emskrank. The local residents were forced out and resettled in the area of Вільгельмскуг, and colonists were brought in to reinvigorate the place. The cartel built houses and shops to give the city a fresh look, they invested in warehouses to handle the traffic surely coming their way, and they built new trading caravels that would be the vanguard of their fleet. Naturally, it was a total disaster.

Хайлігдорф is a religious village dedicated to Manaan. Most of the inhabitants work as fisherman or are in the imperial navy. The village Is one of the biggest supporters of the Nordland mariners giving them many sons to fight.

Located at the eastern extreme of the Drosselspule Bay, Nordland, in truth Нордэн is secretly being developed as base of operations for exploration and conquest of Lustria. It is also used in transporting prisoners to Leopoldheim in the Southlands. Нордэн has an advantage over other ports, in that it’s located close to the Міддэнхайм-Erengrad road, a major thoroughfare for trade and other travel. Until recently, it was an open town where merchants from Міддэнхайм, Nordland, and western Ostland traded goods with ports around the Sea of Claws using large flat vessels suited to the shallow sandy channels around Нордэн. But the town is no longer open to outsiders. Carts and wagons are turned away several miles from Нордэн by halberdiers from the State Army. A trading post at the Manann’s Crown coaching inn in Зальцмораст allows merchants to trade without getting close to the town.

Біілен is a Big town along the Міддэнхайм-Erengrad road. Біілен may not directly benefit economically from its location, it certainly has avoided threats of Norse raiders for years, with Kreideklipper and Зальцмораст providing more lucrative targets. The town of Нордэн, its fortifications and small fleet, are a deterrent to coastal raids. Not to mention the natural geography of the coastline being difficult to navigate. They main trade is grain and wool.

Гельцінг is a trade post on the Міддэнхайм-Erengrad road it mainly sells the fish caught by the fishers of kreideklippe, To merchant caravans on the road. It also has a pleasure house The humming mermaid, Most sailors spend their hard earned coin in the pleasure house.

Крайдэкліппэ is a Fishing village with quite a large fishing fleet. Most people born in Крайдэкліппэ either Work as fisherman or as fish trader. Because of the position of Крайдэкліппэ they are often victim of raids by norscans.
Зальцмораст Famous for its Mannan’s crown coaching inn. It is a large trading post. Зальцмораст territory is a swampy one with salt water.

Харгендорф is a sizable fishing town of Nordland in the Empire, located west of the port city of Дзітэрсхафэн. It is the home of the Imperial Navy's Second Fleet. It also has the dubious honour of being the birth village of Archaon in 2390 IC.Харгендорф is some distance from the main settlements of Nordland, located on the east bank of the River Demst. It's a busy port, where ships stop for provisions and trade vessels buy salt, fish, sheep, and wool. Given its remote location, not much trade offloads at Харгендорф, which makes it ideal for more illicit business.

Manannsheim is an Imperial fort situated on a small island in the Drosselspule Bay of Nordland. It is also home to the Monastery of the Order of the Triton. The fort is heavily armed with canons and trained Nordland mariners.

Вільгельмскуг is a big town with a pilot guild called Manaans eye. The pilots are experts in sailing the Sea of claws and are always onboard of imperial navy vessels. The pilots make sure tradingvessels get safe into the harbour of Ное Эмскранк making sure that the flow of trade doesn't get hindered. Due to the expertise of the pilots the local fisherman are well informed of the spots with the highest quality of fish.

Вольфенбург is the capital of the Grand Principality of Ostland, and Ostland's largest settlement. Nestled in the foothills of the Middle Mountains, it is a beautiful city, and lies at the crossroads of trade moving overland between Kislev and the Empire. Its great walls provide protection from the evil things that lurk within the Forest of Shadows. The von Raukovs, who rule Ostland from Вольфенбург, have brought order and stability to the province after a succession of inept and suspect rulers.

Грунакерэн is a small town south of Вольфенбург on the road to Вурцэн, and is therefore often the final stop for traffic approaching Ostland's capital from the province's key riverport on the Talabec.

Due north of Вольфенбург on the road to Ферланген, and thence Залькальтэн, Мельбэк is a small village of little note beyond its inns catering for travellers. An ancient and abandoned Dwarfen mine is said to be located somewhere west of Мельбэк in the Middle Mountains.
The mining village of Рыштэд lies at the confluence of the River Eiskalt and the Wolf's Run, a short way east of Castle Лэнкстэр.

Вурцэн is a town (sizeable, by Ostland standards) on the north bank of the Talabec River. It is a key riverport for the province, and profits from the lively trade along the Talabec's eastern stretches. It is also one of the major ferry crossings between Ostland and Talabecland to the south.
Чэнгер is a small agricultural village close to Вурцэн, its arable surrounding farmland well irrigated by the River Talabec.
Дарог is a small cattle ranching settlement not far northwest of Вурцэн, close to the Boven Road.

Ферланген is an important market town in central Ostland, and a staging post on the route between Вольфенбург in the south and the northern coastal port of Залькальтэн. Its hereditary rulers are the Beckburg family. It is known nationwide as the home of its famous regiment of handgunners, the Fireloques of Ферланген.
A poor hamlet south of Ферланген, Аўкруг is de facto run by the Trautsun family, the proprietors of the settlement's largest inn and carriage station.
Дункельпфад is a small mining village due south of Öbelstein. Lead, quartz, and silver are extracted from the Middle Mountains by the surrounding mines.

Залькальтэн is one of two towns founded in a failed attempt to draw trade away from Марыенбург (the other being Neues Emskrank in Nordland). Grand Prince Ivan von Königswald poured money into expanding Salkalten’s harbour and beautifying the buildings in 2455 IC. When the promised influx of trade failed to appear, Залькальтэн returned to its previous indolence and the town’s people, with typical Ostlander thriftiness, tore up much of the decorative façade and statues to repurpose. Залькальтэн maintains logging camps in the Forest of Shadows, and most of its industry today is in lumber and fishing, though it remains Ostland's key seaport. It is noteworthy as the home of the Sons of Manann knightly order.
Ферборгенбухт is a fishing village east of Залькальтэн along the coast of the Sea of Claws.

Бохзэнфельс, also known as Little Міддэнхайм, is a fortress-city located in the outer march of Ostland. It is built upon large rocks with caves and tunnels dug underneath, forming a subterranean labyrinth that allows the fortress to maintain enough supplies to hold out against a long siege.
Фогельзанг is a small farming village northwest of Бохзэнфельс. It is the hereditary seat of House Hohenzollern.

Замак Лэнкстэр is a fort overlooking a border crossing that leads through the Middle Mountains to Hochland. It is said that the mountains where it stands were once cursed by the last Dwarf priests of Karaz Ghumzul. It maintains a permanent garrison of Ostlander border guards.
The castle-town of Грэнцбург is the monastic home of the Sigmarite cult of the Purging Hammer. It guards one of Ostland’s main southern roads into Kislev.
Вандэнгарт is a small town west of Грэнцбург, along the Вольфенбург Road. Its primary industries are trade and swine farming. It is the hereditary seat of the von Seeckt family.
Курст is a village within the Forest of Shadows, north of the Вольфенбург-Грэнцбург Road.

The castle-town of Roezfels guards the western passes from Ostland through the Middle Mountains to Hochland. It has long been ruled by the staunchly traditionalist Margraves of the von Döbreiner noble house.
Hereditary seat of House von Öbelstein, Öbelstein is primarily a centre of lumber milling. It lies between Roezfels to the west and Ферланген to the northeast.

The Brass Keep is a very old fortress, indeed it's older than Sigmar himself. No one knows who built it, only that it has changed owners many times, until recently. During the Great War Against Chaos, the fortress was besieged by many Chaos warlords, many pledging their loyalty to Khorne, Slaanesh, Tzeentch, and Nurgle. While it was under siege, the followers of Nurgle corrupted the foundations, fermenting a plague within the fortress. The chaos forces would eventually succeed in taking the fortress, but were then cut off from reinforcements, sealing their doom within. The only survivors of such a glorious plague were the Nurgle devotees themselves, who now bask in the repugnant citadel.

Hidden in the forest of Shadows lies the tower of the Necrach Melkhior the Ancient, After loosing the battle with his former student Zacharias the Everliving the tower was destoyed. After claiming the tower for himself Zacharias decided to rebuild the tower and use it for his study of the Grimoire Necronium.

Тор Літанэль is the capital city of the Wood Elf realm of the Eonir, located in the Ward of the Sun, at the centre of the Laurelorn Forest. The capital of the Laurelorn Forest is a rare surviving example of archaic High Elven architecture. Within the city walls, exotic fruit and nut trees are cultivated with the aid of magic. The huge gems adorning nearly every building contain souls of deceased Elves, held permanently in stasis to preserve them from consumption by Chaos. From a distance, these soul-gems catch the light and cause the city to glisten. Humans who have approached close enough to witness Тор Літанэль's splendour have nicknamed it the City of Glass

Ісьцін Ваул Менлуіт Кайш, also known by mortals as the Rainbow Falls is a small elven hamlet on the border of the Wards of Sun and Frost. Within the waterfall, ruins of stout obelisks of old elven magic had fallen into the crest of the waters, infusing the falls with all 8 winds of magic that coincides with the nearby waystones. Many of Vaul’s disciples gather underneath the waterfall and use the infused waters, and the wind of Chamon and a weak form of Aqshy to coldforge great works of arms and armors.

A dense plantation of larch and firs and larches sacred to Sarriel, God of Dreams. A dense stand of firs and larches near Тор Літанэль is sacred to worshippers of Sarriel, the God of Dreams. Well-trodden paths end abruptly at waystones marking the wood’s edge. Beyond sagging branches draped with curtains of lichen is a heavy, foreboding darkness. Eonir pilgrims are fearful of the spirits within, preferring instead to meditate for dream-visions at the perimeter. At the centre of the wood is a crumbling, overgrown amphitheatre that predates Elf colonists. The Queen of the Laurelorn knows the forum is actually an Old One portal to distant Avelorn, via an esoteric realm called the ‘Dreaming Wood’. The portal is damaged however, making the Dreaming Wood unstable and preventing transit to Avelorn.

Крыніца Лебіна is a village near Тор Літанэль. It is located in a privileged location, since it is located in a huge stone basin that purifies the tainted water of the river beyond the Valley of Despair. These pristine waters make the surrounding land rich and fertile, nourishing crops and trees alike, satisfying the demand of the Eonir population.

Sarrielrien is an Eonir settlement along the path that runs along the laurelorn forest along the coastline. The humid wind that comes from the Sea of Claws creates the ideal environment for the trees to grow stronger and produce larger than usual fruits.

The Wardens of the Frost live nomadically so they can manage the shared forests and ensure that no Imperials settle east of the Demst River. Despite their wandering nature, it is common to see them in the vicinity of Арот Лорэн. This Eonir fortress is their bastion against Nordland's constant efforts to claim this territory for their nation. And also against occasional hordes of Greenskins and Beastmen.

To the East of Тор Літанэль, Кор Іммармор was the neighbouring city in the elder days, when the Human tribes were still uttering guttural language. When Malekith the Deceiver began the War of Vengeance, also known as the War of the Beard to the Elves, Кор Іммармор was the first city to fall in Laurelorn. Now decrepit, many Eonir still visit the ruins to pay their respects and to honour the dead that have fallen there.

The excessively humid climate in the south of the Laurelorn forest has created an ideal ecosystem for certain types of trees and plants to germinate that would not exist in these latitudes. The village of Латайн was founded by the Eonir to benefit from these new resources that the forest offers.

Марыенбург is one of the greatest human cities in the Old World, and possibly the wealthiest, rivalled only by Altdorf, Erengrad, Miragliano, and the richest cities of Araby. Situated at the point where the River Reik enters the Sea of Claws, Марыенбург is the only route for maritime trade to efficiently leave or enter the Empire. The city itself sits on a series of islands connected together by bridges and boat travel. To the north and south, the Vloedmuur wall sits just off the coast to defend the city from flooding and attacks by land. The wall is an ancient one, originally built by elves. The modern wall has been built and rebuilt several times atop the old elven foundations and the Directorate - Marienburg’s executive council - has spent a great fortune modernising its gates and redoubts. The defence of the city from attacks along the Reik, or from the Manaanspoort Sea, falls on Marienburg’s substantial navy. Just a century ago, the Wasteland was one of the jewels of Sigmar's empire, but after generations of benign neglect by a series of successive emperors, the merchants and burghers of Марыенбург declared their independence. Emperor Wilhelm III launched several unsuccessful expeditions against the separatist province, all of which failed, culminating in independence being granted by treaty in 2429. Today, Марыенбург is ruled by its legislature, the Stadsraad, and its executive council, the Directorate. Under this ‘republican’ rule, trade has continued to flow through Марыенбург and many consider the city to be in a golden age. It is protected by its reputation of being nearly ungovernable and its varied mercenary forces, as well as by the River Reik and the marshes and swamps around. Nevertheless, the new Emperor, Karl Franz, may want to accomplish what his great-great-grandfather was unable to do. At the same time, Bretonnian dukes have made attempts in the past to incorporate Марыенбург into their domains; who knows if King Louen will make an attempt of his own to expand the Marches of Куронн?

Бройкўотэр is a poor community along the coast of the Manaanspoort sea, consisting mostly of several run down cottages, a smattering of decrypted inns and a handful of fishing huts. It is the only inhabited settlement on the ancient coast road between Марыенбург and Bretonnia, as such its continued existence is likely only spurred on by traders and travellers. Rumours persist as well that pirates may be using the area as their base of operations, but nothing official has been said or done about them.

Калькаат is a small town located on the road between the Empire and Марыенбург. The people here are wastelanders through and through but do feel a certain loyalty to the empire and its gods. In particular the cult of Sigmar has a very long standing, as well as extremely orthodox, temple here.

On the banks of the river Reik as it flows along the border of the Drakwald forest is the small town of Лейдэнховен. The people here are friendly to travellers and in the Марыенбург fashion will take people into their homes when they need a place to stay. The town mostly subsists on its flocks of sheep, but travellers stopping over from the Empire on their way to Марыенбург often stay in one of their several riverfront inns

At the end of the Old North road, on the coast of the sea of claws and the Wasteland’s border with Nordland and Middenland, is the Barony van Buurens, the last noble house of old Westerland. Baron van Buurens will tell anyone that Аарнаў and its people are the guardians of the Wasteland, though for many decades no one has been quite sure what exactly they are defending against. The city itself is well fortified, and has seen off many Norscan warbands over the years. The State Troops of Аарнаў are well drilled, professional men drawn from soldiers for hire and the local militia. While derisively referred to as the ‘Peacocks’ due to their resplendent uniforms provided by the Baron, they are fine warriors who have faced down highwaymen, outlaws and worse in the nearby Tumble Downs.

On the coast of the Sea of Claws is the village of Холлум. It is said that the settlement was once a large town but that many centuries ago a Norscan raid nearly destroyed everything, leaving only a few scattered survivors and ruins. Today, only the locals can speak of this as they ply their trades and bring in fish from the sea.

Situated on the edge of the Tumble Downs is the farming settlement of Харскамп. The people here raise vegetables and grain for sustenance, but also produce sheep and wool for nearby Аарнаў and often Марыенбург.

Фартэца Солас is a fortified lighthouse across the Manaanspoort sea from Reaver’s point. It is owned and operated by the Wasteland Import-Export exchange in Марыенбург, who maintain a governor and private garrison here. Fort Солас is a relatively new settlement, constructed in response to Almshoven’s abandonment and the destruction of its lighthouse. Most ships will stop here if arriving too late in the evening to make it into Марыенбург, few will stop here with the intention of bypassing Марыенбург all together on their way to Norsca or Kislev.

Горссэль is a large salt mining settlement owned by the Wasteland Import-Export Exchange in Марыенбург. All of the people who live here are ‘Change employees. Salt mining is extremely dangerous, as such the men who work in the mines are very haggard, many have burns on their arms from working with the salt. Горссэль is one of the only salt mines in the old world to not rely on peasant or slave labour for its production. While the miners here may complain about their pays, they are receiving a relatively handsome one.

Фартэца Бергбрэс demarcates the border between the Wasteland and Bretonnia. As part of a deal between the Duke of Жызору and Marienburg’s Directorate, the tolling station is operated by both the excise men of the Wasteland and Gisereux's roadwardens. Both the excise men and the roadwardens are tasked with seeing to the safe flow of trade through the Жызору gap and along the Bitter Moors, but they are notorious for inaction unless suitably ‘paid’ up-front, giving credence to the nickname ‘Fort Beg-Bribe.’ While the tolling station is neutral ground, the fort itself is just over the border in Marienburg’s favour, as such the wealthy city-state has maintained a formidable garrison here.

Castle Куронн stood tall since the time when elves still roamed the lands that are now Bretonnia. Home to the seat of power, its imposing white walls, gleaming in the sunlight, are a testament to the kingdom's enduring strength and the legacy of its noble rulers. Within the fortress lies the revered High Temple of Shallya, where pilgrims and knights alike come to seek the goddess's mercy and healing. Beyond its sacred halls, the castle boasts vast tournament grounds where the bravest of Bretonnia's knights compete in displays of martial prowess, honour, and chivalry. Nearby stands the ancient Abbey of the Grail Companions, a solemn place of worship and remembrance where the legends of Bretonnia’s greatest heroes—those who rode with Gilles le Breton himself—are honoured and preserved. Castle Куронн has endured many sieges in days past, beset by greenskins, beastmen, Norscan marauders, Skaven, and the undead. It has withstood them all and will continue to do.

Рыннэсс is renowned for breeding strong and fast horses. It is one of the few places where nobles willingly suffer the barnlike stench of horse and peasant alike. Young nobles often come here to pick out and reserve the finest horses for themselves. These horses get sent to Куронн where they will receive proper warhorse training and bond with their rider.

Near the River Саньні lies Савіль, an unassuming mining village. Strong workhorses pull large cartloads of iron to Куронн for the knighthood, getting to the ore is a tough job however, as some of the veins run beneath the river.
Занц is a small village next to the river Саньні. Their stables are loaded with the finest workhorses of couronne.

Шанціён was built only recently, but has become a bustling town filled with merchants and travellers. Its original purpose was to guard the eastern side of the road along the coast, but patrols often double up as caravan guards. With recent greenskin incursions and norscan marauders along the coast, caravans enjoy the safety of travelling with a patrol, as long as they stay out of the way.

The people of Юрэсбург make a living catching fish in the sea of claws, the village itself is very clean and has many shipyards along the coast. The nobles have the village under constant watch as the village is very open to marienburgers, and much of the food the village produces ends up going to the big city somehow.

decades ago, the village stopped paying its taxes, the local lord sent out a small unit of “tax collectors”. expecting a ragtag bunch of rebelling peasants, the knights were horrified at what they saw. The village seemed abandoned, but there was blood everywhere. The leader suspected an orc raid but valuables were left behind, they also would have known if a rumbling orc raid would’ve taken place, orcs not being known for their stealth tactics. At the centre they witnessed a gruelling sight, all the men of the village were piled up, their bodies beaten to pulp, their broken bones sticking out from bruised flesh. The women were never found. investigations ran into dead ends. The only thing that stood out, which was dismissed rather quickly, was that the leader of the unit noticed a thick fog moving towards the south, a fog that almost seemed sentient, and he could’ve sworn he saw shapes in the fog. The village was cleansed, the bodies burnt and its history erased. new villagers live here now, unaware of the fate that might await them.
South east of castle Brillionne and west of Куронн castle lies Каўдэбек a big lumber jack village.

Замак Орн lies south of castle Куронн and west of the grey mountains. Its the most southern castle in couronne and it serves mainly as a defensive bulwark against orcs from the grey mountains. Its armed with a lot of trebuchets and archers. its walls are surrounded with mud making it hard for attackers to move.
Брулю is a bridge village west from castle Куронн. There city is build uppon the bridge working as a defendable position for castle Куронн when attacked from the west.

Castle Tancred is only recently completed. It sits on a low but steep hill, and the outer wall is studded with towers. The high inner wall allows defenders to turn the region between the walls into a killing zone, whilst the final round keep also has a tall signal and watchtower. The castle has a good well and large stores of food. Fully manned, it could survive a siege for over threemonths. The surrounding land is not particulary fertile, and it is inlikely that a living army could last that long.

Castle Tancred is only recently completed. It sits on a low but steep hill, and the outer wall is studded with towers. The high inner wall allows defenders to turn the region between the walls into a killing zone, whilst the final round keep also has a tall signal and watchtower. The castle has a good well and large stores of food. Fully manned, it could survive a siege for over threemonths. The surrounding land is not particulary fertile, and it is inlikely that a living army could last that long.

Housing the Great Lighthouse of Bretonnia, also known to the Elves as Tor Alessi, Castle Л'онгій sits on the storm-wracked northern coast of the Middle Sea. Castle Л'онгій is a lucrative trade hub for all sea trade in the northern hemisphere of the old world, and is very defensible thanks to the high cliffs that encase the dukedoms coast. Currently ruled by Godemar Fitzgodric, head of a Merchant Cabal called the Brethren of the Lighthouse, the city remains under control of the Merchant Cabal rather than Duke Taubert, for the Duke despises the city.

Besides the main Harbor of Castle Л'онгій, Брэст harvests the most fish in all of the dukedom of Л'онгій, providing the city and their neighboring villages with plenty of food. The village is somewhat wealthy compared to most Bretonnian Villages, but not nearly as wealthy as their neighbors, Аннумасс and Маромм.

Along with its sister village Маромм, Аннумасс is one of the more wealthy villages in all of Bretonnia. In fact most of its residents are seen as Merchants rather than mere peasants. It is true they still toil day and night working the fields, but behind closed doors, they are inscrutably wealthy compared to the average Bretonnian.

Further inland, past Аннумасс lies the village of Маромм, a vast village in size compared to most. Маромм boasts the largest vineyards in all of Bretonnia, selling their produce to the markets in Castle Л'онгій, where it will be sold and shipped off to far away lands.

Once a small hunting lodge for the Duke and his vassals, the Lodge has been built into a mighty fortress, encompassed by a moat, and two curtain walls. Currently only garrisoned by a few hundred men-at-arms and a handful of Knights, the fortress could house a great host if there were enough men in Л'онгій.

Just off the border of the Forest of Arden and the Dukedom of Артуа, Коттэврард produces all the firewood for the Dukedom of Л'онгій. Because of its location it is frequently raided by Beastman warbands, but are usually quickly dealt with thanks to the perseverance of Duke Taubert.

Just north of the village of Серрак, Castle Серрак sits on top of a hill, and compared to the village below, is more splendid and pleasing to the eye. The triangular shaped keep has watchtowers at each corner, and is encompassed by a palisade wall except for the stone gatehouse and a short section of wall on opposite sides of the gatehouse.

The small destitute village of Серрак is very poor when it comes to Л'онгій standards. Mainly consisting of small dilapidated mud huts, the villagers work tirelessly to appease their lord and pay his tax. There is a rumor amongst the nobles that a group of Herrimaults use the poor village as a base of operations.

Settled on an almost volcanic-like hill next to the Саньні River, Лю Пюі hosts the start of a small pilgrimage for the Lady, known as “The Field of the Lady of Stars.” Although peasants are forbidden to worship the lady, the villagers often undergo the pilgrimage all the way down to Carcassonne.

Барфлёр is a village nestled along the central hills of Ліонэсс. The village is known for its tight-knit community and the sagacious leadership of its elder, Liudver. Despite his frail appearance, Liudver commands great respect and authority, his judgments sought by villagers from neighboring settlements for their fairness and ingenuity. The village itself thrives on small-scale trade, with its position in Ліонэсс giving its seasons bustling with activity as traders come in.

Саблі is nestled on the eastern coast of Ліонэсс, surrounded by the serene waters of the Great Ocean. The village is renowned for its vibrant fishing industry, with fleets of boats setting out each day to harvest the bountiful marine life. The villagers of Саблі are skilled fishermen, and their expertise ensures a steady supply of fresh fish to the markets of Ліонэсс.

Сорэй is a village known for its diligent shipwrights. The city is a center for artisans and craftsmen, whose works are renowned throughout Bretonnia. The harbor is always busy, with fishermen and shipwrights working tirelessly to support the local economy.

Вуарун is a village renowned for its vineyards and fine wines. Nestled among rolling hills, Voiron’s annual wine festival attracts connoisseurs from all over Bretonnia, celebrating the village’s rich winemaking tradition.

Карэкуфу is a serene village surrounded by lush meadows and dairy farms. The villagers are renowned for their cheese-making skills, producing high-quality cheeses that are a staple of the northern Ліонэсс economy.

Bordering the Dukedom of L'Anguille is Барлей Мотт, a strategic castle situated on a hilltop that oversees the surrounding northern Ліонэсс hills. The castle serves as a military stronghold and a symbol of protection for the neighboring villages. However, the location is also infamous in Bretonnia for being home to bandits, necromancers, and Chaos cults, with most Lyonens believing the Motte to be cursed despite its strategic importance.

Лю Гавр is the only Ліонэсс port village with naval access to the Sea of Chaos. Vital to maritime trade, the docks are always busy with ships transporting goods to and from distant lands, and the villagers are known for their skills in navigation and commerce.

Зігмарсхайм is an outpost of the Empire situated in the Forest of Arden. It serves as a strategic fort, built around a temple dedicated to Sigmar. It is said that upon reaching adulthood, the Imperials of Зігмарсхайм have a tradition of venturing towards the Empire for a year to bring back a spouse.

Situated in the western outskirts of the Forest of Arden, Контрумуля is a village known for its fertile fields and agricultural productivity. The villagers grow a variety of fruits and vegetables, supporting the local economy and providing fresh produce to nearby markets.

Ора Ламай is a small yet formidable castle nestled between Ліонэсс and the ruins of the once-great Mousillon. The castle has seen better days, having fallen into neglect under the rule of Bayard Solon, who governs the lands in the name of the absent King Charles de la Tête d'Or III. The castle's walls, though not particularly high, are sturdy and well-built, with a single towering black spire that looms ominously over the surrounding landscape. Despite its formidable appearance, the guards of Ора Ламай have grown complacent in the decade since the last raid. The castle's strategic position, far from the sea, has led to a false sense of security among its defenders.

Дзьепп is an inland village known for its thriving livestock farms. The village is renowned for its production of high-quality wool and dairy products, which are traded in nearby markets. The residents of Дзьепп are skilled farmers and herders, working tirelessly to maintain the prosperity of their community.

Замак Жызору sits perched on a ridgeline, just north of where the River Ois flows into the Grismerie. A mile long curtain wall encloses the castle, which consists of two large keeps and many other outbuildings. Duke Hagen is rarely seen in either the castle or the city at his feet as he is normally in Куронн or on campaign, and so his steward Lord Hincmar lives in one of the two keeps, while the other remains deserted. The city sprawls from the rivers’ shores to the castle’s ridge; It is a busy place, filled with more Imperial and Wastelander traders than any other city in Bretonnia, it may in fact be the only place in the world were the name of Марыенбург does not conjure up images of sea vessels. Much of the city is dominated by streets of fine merchant houses pressed up against horrid tenements and decaying homes, many of which once belonged to fine merchant families. In Жызору, it is said that merchant families will only keep their wealth for one generation. As can be expected by its location, the city and castle has been besieged numerous times over its long history, but any knight of the dukedom will be quick to tell you that it has fallen not once due to her valiant knights.

To the north east of Castle Жызору; some ways off the main road, is the pastoral village of Пьеррулатт. The land here is not particularly fertile, but its slopes and plains are excellent for shepherds and breeders to raise their flocks and herds.

Right on the road between Castle Жызору and Castle Дыфлёв is the village of Эрні. While the people here do make most of their living on raising livestock, its location along the road makes it a prime place as a stop, either in the direction of the Empire or deeper into Bretonnia.

High on the side of the mountain in the Pale Sisters near the headwaters of the River Ois, is the small town of Отмун. There is no permanent residence here for its lord, Duke Hagen, and so any fortifications and buildings here have been wrought by the peasantry over many centuries of inhabitation. The town is the only stop on the trail to the Vale of Florida, and it is from here that many nobles have attempted to sponsor further settlement of the Pale sisters. All of these attempts have failed miserably, either due to the harsh winters or greenskin incursions; and so it has been some time since further settlement has been tried.

The village of Флорыд sits in the middle of the Vale of Florida. It is very inaccessible even for a mountainous area. The vale’s orientation is unique in that it traps sunlight; making the area unusually warm. It only snows during the coldest of winters and flowers bloom here for most of the year. A stream flows off the mountains to the south of the village, irrigating the vale for farming, and dropping in a spectacular waterfall to join the headwaters of the River Саньні below. The soil of the vale in particular seems to nourish a certain flavour in grapes. The flavour is said to be an acquired taste, but many aficionados will travel from far and wide to acquire it.

Halfway up the mountain road to Отмун, and along the upper Ois river sits the mining settlement of Паль. It is one of only three examples of successful Bretonnian settlement of the Pale sisters, the others of course Отмун itself and Флорыд.

Замак Ойзільён sits on top of a ridge, guarding the road that runs along the foot of the Pale Sisters towards Жызору. It is a humble place on the edge of the Forest of Arden and mostly used as a watch over the area for beastmen warherds and greenskin WAAGH!s. Slightly higher up the ridge from the present Castle Ойзільён is a large area of Ruins. The locals say that this is the “Palace Ойзільён,” where one of the old great Bretonnian kings made his court here. While you have never heard of this palace or its king, you are sure there are many things you do not know about.

The Village of Ойзіль sits in the valley between the Ойзільён ridge and the Pale Sisters. It is a quiet place, fearful of outsiders and the mountains that they sit at the feet of. One of the very few Bretonnian settlements to survive in these parts of the mountains, it has known the wrath of both vagabonds and greenskins.

Замак Дыфлёв guards the border between the Reik basin and Bretonnia. Directly across the Жызору gap from Fort Бергбрэс, Castle Дыфлёв and its lord, Marquis Дыфлёв, are tasked with guarding against smugglers and nerdowells attempting to enter into or escape from Bretonnia.

Fauesnant is a small community on the road near Castle Дыфлёв. While most travellers keep moving from Фуэнан on to Эрні or elsewhere, its location brings the village enough coin to get by, if not rise to wealth.

Betton sits at the foot of the southern Pale Sisters, while most people here lead typical Bretonnian lives tilling the soil, a number of peasants have successfully found valuable metals in the mountains nearby..

On the river Grismerie south of Castle Жызору is the ancient Castle Ард. Established here long ago to guard the approaches along the river both to and from Mousillon. Today, the castle has been worked into the Cordon Sanitaire as the principal fort in this region.

Cutting timber for use in the city of Жызору, the people of Бунмам lead modest lives. While paid for directly by the Duke, timber does not afford much wealth, especially in the face of the various threats facing Бунмам, both those of the nearby swamp and the Forest of Arden.

Замак Артуа is a large fortress city, without any villages outside its walls it stands a lone vigil inside the forest of arden. It is the Ducal capital of Артуа and Chilfroy’s main base of operations, but can be mostly found riding out to hunt beastmen. Its large curtained walls hide an imposing keep and a large courtyard, used to provide for the large number of knights and mounted yeomen, because of this, a constant stream of provisions are necessary, and the steady stream of wagons that provide these is almost constant.

5 years ago this village was like any other, miserable peasants eking out a meagre existence providing for their lord. But that changed when the skaven poisoned their water supply, as the town began to mutate, the skaven attacked. Unfortunately for them, Sir Madregang, who himself began to mutate, beat back the skaven attack. Shortly after, Ўэсін executed those whose minds were twisted and beyond saving, a dark day in their history. The village now acts as a growing haven for the twisted and mutated, which the duke doesn’t mind because he barely notices the difference.

one of the few villages with a fortified wall surrounding it. The villagers are proud of its large cathedral dedicated to the lady, but there is more to this than meets the eye, in the back of the cathedral, behind locked doors guarded by hermit knights, rests one of the sacred texts of the lady, which are only allowed to be seen by grail knights. The beastmen can sense the aura of purity it radiates and frequently attack the village. They have thus far been unsuccessful, for the local duke usually rides out to trample them into the mud, and even if the duke doesn’t show up, the villagers are well trained in the arts of the bow.

Ларрэт has only recently achieved its status as a city, thanks to recent construction of paved roads, connecting Ларрэт to major trade routes. Ларрэт is a decent place to live, where everyone is treated almost equally. The roads are clean, the buildings are well maintained and crime is low. Ларрэт has its secrets of course, if the town grows too hard, the poor are rounded up and told to leave, those exiled who are found still lingering too close to Ларрэт are promptly executed, something the inhabitants of Ларрэт try their best to ignore.

Амбрыкурт is an important village between Ларрэт and the major trade route that Амбрыкурт borders. Ever since the construction of the paved road that cuts through the village it has seen an increase in trade caravans. The village provides food and lodging, preparing the caravans for their trip to Ларрэт.

Лянэстэр is a large commune of farmers and shepherds, surrounded by castle artois in the north east and Ларрэт in the south west the village is relatively safe from outside threats. Лянэстэр sees a decent bit of traffic, but because of the village’s rundown state these rarely stay for long.

Замак Аррас was once a beautiful fortress city, but a particularly strong beastmen army rampaged through the south of Артуа and laid siege to Аррас, many feats of architecture fell to ruin under the rock barrage of the cygors, Ghorgons pummeling everything in their wake to dust and Jabberslythes clumsily crashing into marvellous statues. If not for the then Sir Chlodega the city would’ve been razed completely. Sir Chlodega led a charge deep into the ranks of the beastmen, so forceful was the charge that it toppled even the cygors. The sounds of carnage and death lured out the other beasts that roamed the city, and after an epic battle the knight slaughtered every single one of them. The city, what was left of it, was saved. From the remains of the ruined city the castle was built, and still watches over the southern part of artois.

In ages past the village of Генгам was the site of many battles against greenskins, beastmen and undead. Now its walls are left to ruin, its garrison almost abandoned and the houses are in disrepair. Its chapel however is still as grand as it was when it was first built, and keeps spirits high in the area. The people can fend for themselves and are well fed.

In the southern part of the forest of arden lies Замак Ленс, a great bastian amidst a sea of trees. Its strategic position deep in the woods ensures that many tribes of beastmen attack the castle, and inevitably fail. The garrison at castle lens is experienced and self-sufficient, collecting water from nearby streams and hunting game in the woods. At times however it becomes impossible to leave the castle, a particularly great brayherd might lay siege to the castle, so it's important the stocks are filled.

The people of Ойссэль are always busy tending fields, herding cattle, fishing or hunting game. Every week a squad of knights and yeomen come to the village to escort a cart full of food back to Castle Ленс, which in return keeps the village of Ойссэль safe, the villagers know how frequent the attacks on the castle are, and therefore double their efforts to make sure the garrison is well fed, if only to save their own skin.

Замак Bélthue watches over the eastern part of the forest of arden, the beastmen here are mainly brays, but the garrison is no less undermanned. Sometimes a greenskin incursion makes it through the pale sisters, crushing any beastmen resistance and ploughing through to the west into the lands of man, these are swiftly stopped, experienced woodsmen take potshots at the warbands before retreating back into the woods. When the greenskins reach an open field they are met with lance and blade, and are put to the sword quickly and efficiently.

The villagers of tournon are experienced woodsmen, and often aid in redirecting a greenskin incursion or warherd that stampedes through the woods, the villagers have learned that you don’t necessarily need accuracy to beat an opponent, firing off a load of arrows in a general direction from a hidden spot is usually very effective to make the enemy think they are outnumbered and go the other way, usually into a knight’s lance.

The Fortress city of Мунфор, sits at the opposite end of Axe Bite Pass. Encompassed in five tiers of towering stone walls, the Illustrious trade centre is renowned for its fine quality crafts, including Steel weapons and armours, owed to the close association of the Dwarfs of the Grey Mountains.
A small village located near the Bretonnian Entrance to Axe Bite Pass. Жуінар acts as a small trade settlement before encroaching on Мунфор.
The hamlet of Hachpied, across the river from Мунфор, is a small cattle farm that provides Castle Мунфор with a steady supply of Meats and Hides.

Хяэ lies at the entrance of axe bite pass and is the first Bretonnia contact coming through the pass. Unfortunately, due to the Empire and Bretonnia’s constant engagements over axe bite pass, the village of Хяэ is littered with graves and corpses.

Sitting north west of Мунфор, the City of Пуссанк rests on the River Grismerie. The markets of Пуссанк are often flooded with Golden jewellery and crafts, thanks to it neighbouring the gold rich Grey Mountains.
Huddled on the north side of the Grismerie river, the village of Ле Шалем is a small farming village that provides most of its harvest to the city of Пуссанк.
Сіро is a small village that is not very populous, nor flourishing, and that holds a deep clay deposit just off the river bank of the Grismerie river.
In the small woodlands east of Пуссанк, the hamlet of Ардун provides Пуссанк with timber for many of the cities' construction and outfitting their militias with bows and arrows.
Castle Хіммерль sits on the border of Парравун and Мунфор, along the river Grismerie. It is a key defensive choke point into Мунфор when approaching from the south.
West of Мунфор, the small village of Бьер, provides Castle Мунфор's supply of mounts for the stables. Although small, Horse breeders are never in short supply in the Horse Duchies of Bretonnia.

The hogs of Ітуа provide most of its meat and its leather hides to Castle Мунфор. The rest is usually reserved for the village itself or as a trade good for any adventurers or other villages needing such goods. Due to the location, Ітуа has a good relationship with the small village of Лаваль in Парравун, and they often trade goods and hold small festivals together.

Ле Уксон holds a small knit community of villagers who farm flax for the cities of Мунфор. Despite being neither prosperous nor populous, the work they do does not go unnoticed and is often protected from Greenskin raids.

Along a small stream that runs from Axe Bite Pas, and into the Grismerie river, lies the small hamlet of Буль. The residents there work in the small salt mines up into the sides of Axe Bite Pass and into the Grey Mountains.
Neighbouring the Mountains of Massif Orcal, Гет Оркаль sits at its base, ready to pursue any and all greenskin raids coming from the Mountains.
Just east of Гет Оркаль lies the hamlet of Giley, a small fishing village sitting on the Grismerie river. The village is not very prosperous due to increasing raids from Greenskins.
Мунфор, fertile and rock free soil is in short supply, making Морту, or rather its soil, critical to abating famine. As a result, Мортуan peasants are thought of as fat and lazy by their fellows.

The city of Парравун, built by the elves long ago, was cut from a lone mountain, Les Monts Seuls, and runs directly along the Grismerie river. Surrounded by deep chasms, it is a key fortress city in holding off any enemies from the Grey Mountains and beyond, from reaching central Bretonnia. Due to the location, many Dwarf families have flocked to Парравун. It is also notable for being the only place in Bretonnia where peasants can live in Stone houses. This is due to a trick of legal language; the homes the peasants carve out of the rock of Les Monts Seuls are considered ‘Caves’ and thus are not prohibited.

The village of Альлёброж is a renowned settlement for its particular horse breeders, even among Paravon which sees use of mainly Pegusi. Альлёброж has a fair population and sees many visits by Nobles and Travelers alike.

Not far from the Grey Mountains lies Жонсіань, a small village with a main focus on Iron mining within the Grey Mountains. Heavily patrolled due to its strategic nature, Жонсіань holds Paravon’s economy by the pillars.
Near the Grey Lady Pass, Гуаярд holds a decent size of villagers, and militia alike. Being the first village into Bretonnia from Grey Lady pass, it is quite defensible and strategic in nature.

Found north of the Парравун forest, just north of the Hills of the Dead, and east of Castle Парравун lies Грунэр. Its location offers it a decent defensive position at the base of the Grey Mountains, and the Hills of the Dead aids in its defence of the south from attack.
Clemenceau is a village located halfway between Grunere Castle and the Forest of Athel Loren.
The small mining village of Вэттар resides due south of the City of Грунэр, past the Hills of the Dead. They are destitute and have learned to fend for their own when things get perilous.

The small cloister of ля Мізунталь abbey is home to a host of Taalite monks. Home to the Holy Wardens of ля Мізунталь, these Battle Monks will learn to fight in the ways of war and join Grail Knights on their own quests to collect relics.

In the west of Парравун, near the borders of Мунфор, Лаваль holds a tight knit relationship with its neighbour, Ітуа. They often trade goods, such as raw materials for leather and hides. During the Lily Day, the two villages have many weddings and hold a small festival.

Табанэ is a small militarised village that houses most of the Militia Guards of Castle Вонцьен. Even though the village focuses on wheat farming, the Villagers, and Guards, will protect their homes with their lives.

Just south west of Castle Paravon lies the village of Lesevre, which hosts large deposits of Wood. Lesevre is very rich in wealth due to Castle Paravon needing coal to fuel the smithies for production of weapons and armour.

Located in the heart of Bastonne, Замак Бастонн and the surrounding villages show many indications of their founder, the first king Gilles le Breton, or Gilles the Unifier. Замак Бастонн itself is almost always a pilgrimage for any Grail Knights, or any who wish to see the testimony of Gilles le Breton’s accomplishments.

Directly east of Bastonne, Сант-Эцьен surveys the eastern border of Bastonne with Мунфор. Within the vast verdant fields, the ponies of Bastonne freely breed and openly commune with many Bastonnians. Indeed, they are even smart enough to realize they offer them much protection from the many creatures and monsters of Massif Orcal.

North of Massif Orcal, the small settlement of Вішы endures constant raids from Greenskins and strange rat-like beastmen. Indeed, in the past the village elders were forced to “collaborate” with these strange rat-like beastmen to avoid destruction. They are a hardy breed of peasants and have sustained many traumas.

In the verdant green fields of Урыяк, the peasants there thrive off the trade of many Cattle hides and meats. Indeed whatever is left after the many tithes, Урыяк is able to make very little profit, and mainly survives off of communal farming.

In the north of Bastonne on the Grismerie river, near the Мунфор border, the small city of Суд dwells. Being in the Heartlands of Bretonnia, the marketplaces of Суд are often filled to the brim with many goods that come from across Bretonnia. Including even foreign goods from the Empire, and the Wood Elves of the Loren Forest. Due to the nearness of Мунфор, relations are straining, and long ago many border wars between the two dukedoms occurred.
Клермон-Ферро is a little fishing village along the Grismerie river that sits across from the Мунфор border. The village is fairly small sized due to fish not being a huge export out of the village.
Located in northern Bastonne, Іссуар is a predominantly farming community with some small abodes available for passerby adventurers or pilgrims on their way to Замак Бастонн.

Located at the northernmost point of Bastonne, Цьер lies on the border of Giseroux. Цьер is a small trade hub that is visited by many caravans from the dukedom of Giseroux, but has had a harsh bit of bad luck recently due to dreadful Beastmen raids coming from the Arden forest.

Замак Гарамун holds the southern border of Bastonne from the western border of Bordeleaux, and provides a watchful lookout of the forest of Chȃlons and the feet of the mountains of Massif Orcal. The garrison has held off many Greenskin invaders.

Омбер in the past has been raided, pillaged, and razed many times over in the past by Greenskin raiders from Massif Orcal. Calard of Garamont has sent many families to re-inhabit Омбер again, in a vain hope that the village will continue its production of timber from the Chalons Forest.

Lying just before the borders of Жызору, the fortress of Sangasse is a sentinel for any monsters or creatures that wish to venture out from the Arden forest. Indeed, many Beastmen raids have been thwarted by the garrison of knights stationed here.

Behind the defenses of Замак Сонгас, Кюссэ harbors a small salt deposit right off the bank of the Grismerie river. Most of its supply of salt is directed straight to Castle Bastonne’s kitchens and warehouses.

Built inside the old remains of a small castle, Шатэль-Гіён is a small farming community that harvests flax from its fields. Due to the location, the fields are vibrant and yield extraordinary amounts of silk. Many inhabitants believe great battles were once fought in the very fields of Шатэль-Гіён to bring about its great harvests.

The village of Лапс is home to a hardened group of men and women who have had to fight the dangers of Музільён for their homes for centuries. Many of Laps’ inhabitants voluntarily ask for employment under their protector Luca Loup so they can take the fight to the haggard entities that call Музільён their home.

Directly east of the dread city of Музільён lies Ард. The hamlet has been targeted for many raids by bandits, highwaymen, and even cultists. Its closeness to Музільён has always made it easy pickings for the horrors that dwell in the cloudy mists of Музільён.

Built upon ancient stonework, the fortress-city of Bordeleaux is perhaps the most important harbour in Bretonnia, rivalled only by Lyon. Замак Бордулю sits on a cliff which rises above the harbour, looking over the entire sprawling city and nearby sea traffic. It is said that the engines on its walls, and their skilled engineers, are capable of sinking a moored rowboat without damaging the boats to either side. The city is home to two major holy sites in the realm, the First Chapel of Замак Бордулю, the most sacred Grail Chapel in the kingdom; and the Temple of Manaan, of which some say rivals even the temple in Марыенбург.

Right on the coast of the Great Ocean is the village of Saint Junien. Saint Junien was named after a grail knight who long ago defended the peasants in the area from mysterious sea devils. The peasants here continue to rely on Manaan for their livelihood, though many visitors note that they always seem to have one eye out towards the watery horizon.
Sitting on the road between Tureene and Bordeleaux is Эгр. Эгр is an idyllic place, the peasants here seem content most years and grain normally comes in abundance.
The area around Niort is famous for its vineyards. The fruit produced here makes a nice red wine, favoured by many nobles all over Bretonnia.

The peasant town of Цюрэнн, though lowly, is nothing to scoff at. The people here live under the protection of the duke and while most make their living in the fields around the town, there are those peasants that have taken up a craft or trade near the town square. Цюрэнн is a town dependent on the excesses of Bordeleaux, merchants needing a simple place to stop can often find cheaper rooms and supplies here.

Surrounded by rocky crags, the isolated village of Parthenay sits on a hill overlooking the lands of Bordelen and, across the River Grismerie, Музільён. The people here haul up salt from the beaches below, pack it, and send it to Цюрэнн to their south.
The people of Онгле pride themselves on breeding some of the best riding stock this side of Massif Orcal. Every year, the peasants round up the various herds, and drive them to market in Bordeleaux.

Руаё lays in a low and wide gulley, sheltered from the winds that constantly blow across the coastal plains of Bordeleaux. The depression also provides some sanctuary from norscan raiders, who often are unable to see it from the ocean.
Дагло is a small farming village that provides the nearby temple of Verena with most of its foodstuffs. The fruit grown here is known for its hardiness, and can make a decent vintage.

The fish that come down into the brackish waters of the River Grismerie are known for their size and their taste. Really, many local nobles suppose that is the only reason the peasants continue to dwell in Талёнс, being far too close to the marshes of cursed Музільён for their liking.

A small castle, established to watch over the farms and woodlands of east Bordelen. It is named after a long dead noble who stopped an orc warboss from Massif Orcal on the grounds where the castle now sits.

In the middle of the rolling plains is the village of Бэльвэс. Бэльвэс has some of the most.. provincial peasants in Bordeleaux. Their lord rarely comes here, with the yeoman tax collector often being the only visitor to Бэльвэс for years at a time.

Сар Saddlebreds are dependable mounts for any knights, yeomen or traveller. The people here pride themselves on producing steads of the highest quality, the result of course is that they only produce a few every season.

On the edge of the Forest of Châlons sits Castle Шатэльру. Châlons is a dangerous and twisted place; dark trees stand over deep ravines, boulders and chasms. One shouldn't be mistaken, it has its beauties; sweet and cool streams, waterfalls and calm pools dot the undergrowth. It is even said that the true sacred lake of the lady lies somewhere within this forest. With this land, comes the typical predations, greenskins, beastmen and far worse make their homes, and so Шатэльру stands its watch against incursion.

Delving into the forest of Châlons for timber, the woodsmen of Мунпазье are some of the bravest peasants in all Bordelen. Their daily task brings them almost constantly into contact with beastmen and other foul monstrosities.

The peasants of Лімой venture into the outlying crags of Massif Orcal, looking for sites for clay pits. While they bring back a good amount of clay, they also tell tales of the things they encounter at the foot of the mountains. The local lord has on more than one occasion deemed fit to send men-at-arms into the foothills. What they fought there remains unknown to most.

The jewel of Bretonnia, as Brionnians would have you believe, is a remarkable city built out of the local white stone and the high quality sand from its bay, which is one of the things Брыён is famous for. The city is well defended thanks to its location, lone towers watch over the land that can withstand against entire armies with but a small garrison. The Hall of Minstrels is the most important building in Брыён, as many would be bards and minstrels hone their skills here. The hall is surrounded by a large garden, which in times of war can be used as a killing room to dispose of invaders. It is a beautiful circular structure made from polished white stone, the inside is home to an auditorium with flawless acoustics, which minstrels use at any time of the day or night.
On the coast of the Great Ocean, the village of Люрд ekes out a meagre existence as a fishing village. Delivering “fresh” fish directly to Castle Брыён.
The village of Турнэфоль, the last settlement on the River Brienne before Castle Брыён. The villagers here take care of great herds of cattle, providing much of the meat needed by the dukedom.

A moderately rich farming village near Брыён, Букер acts as a crossroads between the surrounding villages and Брыён so it sees a decent bit of traffic, thanks to the local toll booth the village is slightly more prosperous than the others, but still just as run down.

Люнэль sees many travellers pass by as they live close to the bridge that connects them with Каркассон, be they adventuring knights or merchants. The village therefore is looked after more than others, so passing nobles can at least somewhat bear to look at it.

Gaillac doesn’t get many visitors, being so out of the way, yet caravans often leave to deliver crops to Chateau Frontière. Gaillac is one of the biggest food producers of Брыён.Gaillac, a remote location that often goes unnoticed, being so far away from the main roads. The village is a bustling hub for caravans that transport crops to Chateau Frontière. Gaillac holds a critical role in Brionne’s food production.

A somewhat dour village along the northern border, when Castle Gransette was beset by zombies many of those who fled, fled to Монд, dragging several zombies in tow. The attack was repelled, but it left its mark on the village; houses are more rundown and desolate than usual, and the faint stench of death still lingers in the air.
The local nobility is more keen to make visits to Кольюр, as they supply most of Брыён with olives, used for their cuisine. This is why the village is more staunchly protected in times of need.

Castle Хоссэгор is more of a giant hospital than a mere fortress. Inside, nobles receive the finest treatments from priestesses of Shallya; while outside peasants beseech the many wisemen and healers that flock to the area. Some complain about receiving their treatment in the open air, but many of the practitioners believe this separation protects their noble clients and disperses the more vile miasmas brought here by the peasants.
The bleating of the herds of local sheep drown out most of the noises during the day, Фуа delivers copious amounts of cotton to Castle Хоссэгор to be used for bandages and cleaning materials.

Nestled in the rolling hills and verdant fields, lies Коламье, where the air is always fragrant with the aroma of herbs. The village is a picturesque haven with neat rows of herbs that flourish under the warm rays of the sun. The villagers take great pride in their craft, carefully tending to their plants with love and care.

The village of Біжэр is surrounded by fields and pastures, with castle Portet looming in the distance, a constant reminder of the feudal system that governs the life of the locals. The villagers are hardworking and resilient, eking out a living from the land and the trades they have honed over generations.

The village of Савэрда is a dusty and bustling place, with narrow streets and buildings. Despite the arduous and often dangerous nature of their work, these villagers are a tight-knit community, bound together by a shared sense of purpose and a deep respect for the land. They know the secrets of clay, how to shape it, and finding the best veins to mine.

Located in the southwestern region of the dukedom lies its distinguished capital city of Аквітань. The cityscape is dominated by the majestic ducal castle, which stands as a testament to the grandeur of the region. The castle is renowned for its remarkable Lace Tower, a towering spire crafted with an intricate design of numerous windows, giving it the appearance of delicate stone lace.
Nestled in the shadow of Castle Аквітань, the village of Баённ exudes charm and tranquillity. Surrounded by lush meadows, it is one of the more peaceful villages of the already tranquil dukedom.
Situated to the east of Castle Аквітань is the hamlet of Пу. Surrounded by vibrant fauna, Пу is a rather small hamlet with its quaint cottages and serene brook that winds through its centre.

Known for its skilled weavers, Хаспаррэн thrives on its vibrant market, where the fruits of their labour are traded with fervour. The peasants, hardy and resourceful, draw strength from their close-knit community and the protective presence of the nearby castle.

Standing as the pinnacle of Aquitainian fortification, Chateau D'Epee is an awe-inspiring castle situated near the border of Брыён. The castle's origins can be traced back to Lord D'Epee's great-grandfather, a legendary adventuring knight known for his involvement in numerous feuds and exploits not unusual for an Aquitainian. Harnessing his accumulated wealth, he constructed this very fortress that would soon stand to defy all assailants for decades to come.

Situated on the far northern fringes of Аквітань's domain, Derrevin is marked by its proximity to the Forest of Châlons to its north. The village's once-thriving population has dwindled, its homes and streets displaying scars of past feuds.
Pessac remains its mark on the map for a reason; the popularity of its white wine vintage. Pessac wine is one of the best Aquitaine wines, valued for its light, crisp flavors and smooth undertows.

Ажо stands as a bastion of agricultural resilience, proudly standing as one of the most fertile villages in the already fertile region. Its fertile farms yield an abundance of grains, providing sustenance for the entirety of the dukedom. The hard working peasants toil diligently to continue feeding the hungry people of Аквітань.

Nestled within the farmlands of Аквітань, Castle Лібурн rises as a bastion of elegance and refinement. Situated amidst rolling hills and verdant meadows, this picturesque castle exudes an air of tranquillity and grace that exemplifies the relative peace the dukedom is known for.

Known for its vast vineyards, Нэрак once flourished as a centre of winemaking, but now the toil of its remaining inhabitants is relentless. Under the watchful eye of the ruling lord of Castle Лібурн, the villagers of Нэрак endure, their spirits tested by the harsh realities of their existence.

Perched on the northern outskirts of Castle Libourne, the village of Wainfleet presents a clear break in societal norms compared to the rest of Aquitaine. Wainfleet is where the pesant Grail Knight Ser Geg makes his court, and where numerous peasants flock to to become his... 'Squights.'
