Rising majestically amidst the rugged landscapes of Аквітань is Castle Мунфлонка. Perched atop a hill, this stronghold epitomises strength and strategic advantage. Its stonework, weathered by the passage of time, exudes an aura of ancient resilience.
Biarritz is a town south of Aquitaine Castle, near the border with Brionne.

Compared to its sister village of Бьяррыц, the village of Ayherre serves as an idyllic retreat from the tumult of war, a sanctuary where weary adventurers find respite amidst the constant feuds of the dukedom. With fields of golden wheat stretching as far as the eye can see, Ayherre's economy thrives on agriculture, its diligent farmers reaping the fruits of their labour.

Just a stone's throw away from the formidable walls of Castle Кюрмонт lies the village of Bergerac. While relatively unremarkable, life in Gradignan is a delicate balance, as the peasants navigate the thin line between sustenance and boredom, no doubt thanks to its rather safe position.

Situated somewhat north of Castle Кюрмонт is the humble hamlet of Bergerac. While the village does not get as much trade as its neighbouring settlements, it still benefits from the dukedom's more peaceful setting. Most of its traffic comes from its prosperous mining community thanks to the discovery of a silver deposit nearby.

The fortress city and the ducal capital of Каркассон, Castle Каркассон sits on an island surrounded by the river Songez. Due to the defensive location Castle Каркассон is designed to be more of a fortress rather than a city, however there is a small town attached to the castle that acts as a marketplace and hub for many travelers and Knights who seek services.
Located near the Border of Каркассон and Брыён on the river Brienne, maintains a trusting relationship with the outlying villages of Люнэль and Vauvert, having been trade partners for ages past.

Located at the base of the Irana Mountains, the village of Альбі has been host to countless raids from Greenskin tribes. As such, the shepherds have become battle hardened and will defend their village from any oncoming monstrosities.
East of Каркассон lies the farm village of Cahors. Although not very populous, Cahors is an asset to Castle Каркассон, providing most of their grain to feed the fortress town.

Located in the Vaults , the City of Цюра is the capital of the Barony of Savoie. The region is influenced heavily by nearby Tilea, despite this the city and people are steadfastly loyal to Bretonnia. Holding the famed relic, the “Shroud of Gilles le Breton” the City of Цюра is a Pilgrimage site to all who follow the Lady of the Lake, and all who seek visions of the Lady.

Having been sacked by Greenskin invaders many times in the past, the population of Montebaun is very low. Being one of the few timber villages in carcassonne, the remaining peasants here are often worked to the bone.
Sitting south of the Кунэль border and the river Brienne, the village of Шана is a small farming community that provides its grain to the City of Цюра.
Just west of Шана, along the Breinne river, the small land is home to many olive fields, worked tirelessly by the Tilean influenced Bretonnian peasants.

Located on the western border of Каркассон and at the base of the Irana Mountains, Тулуз is a vital defensive position that holds the River Niveau crossing, that separates the border of Каркассон and Estalia.
Кондум is a timber village located in the most north western part of Каркассон, that borders Estalia and the Duchy of Брыён.

Nestled in the western Irana Mountains, Muret is a mining town that has become a fierce recruiting ground for Каркассон Knights. The peasants are avid blacksmiths and miners, and will not shy away from a fight with Greenskins.

In the green pastures of western Каркассон lies the village of Монтэськью. The lush fields of green attract many breeds of Bretonnian Horse, which has made the village quite wealthy compared to most Bretonnian villages.

A small fortress settlement on the Southern Reach of Bretonnia near the Tilean border. Once besieged by the armies of Tilea, the siege turned to a massacre when Ser Der Raker broke the assailants single handedly.

In the eastern plains of Каркассон, Енн sits just opposite of the village Перпіньё on the river Pou. Just outside of Енн lies the Burial Mound of Grundsnik, an orc warboss who was defeated many centuries ago. Orcs occasionally come here, seeking to reclaim Grundsnik’s treasure.
A small mining village on the eastern base of the Irana Mountains and the Western Vaults, the Village of Cugnaux are hardened miners, working iron for the city of Цюра and beyond.

At the crossing of the river Brienne and the river Pou, Эскалькас grows flax for the city of Цюра. Because of their Tilean lineage, Эскалькас is quite prosperous and rich compared to the surrounding villages.

Located near the borders of the Loren Forrest, Castle Гудару is an ever watchful eye that stands at the base of the Vaults mountain range. Castle Гудару is a key position for maintaining Bretonnian rule over the northern end of the Novalone Pass, as well as for guarding the Loren highway.

Соліньяк Ля Руж is the last Bretonnian settlement along the Loren Highway. Travelers heading towards Kreutzhafen will typically pick up anything they need for the long journey there from the peasants here. The people here feel uncomfortably close to the Fey of Cavaroc, but relations with Athel Loren remain as amicable as possible.

A de facto marker for the border between Tilea and Bretonnia, Mont de Marsan sits in the Novalone Pass. Many people here are in fact Tileans who make their living facilitating trade between Каркассон and Miragliano.

On the coast of the river Pou, near where the tributary feeds into the Brienne, sits the village of Перпіньё. Перпіньё being so close to the Novalone Pass has a large Tilean influence on the people here.

Perrach is a small farming community on the road between Castle Кунэль and Мэрсу Дэклу. The peasants here nar to go towards the woods in any way, so in fear they are of the Fey who watch over them from the shade of the trees.

In the flatlands of Кунэль, surrounded by a sea of grassgrasses and farmlands, is the village of Найю. The peasants here raise cattle on the fine grasses for most of the year. When it comes time to drive the cattle to market in Кунэль, the village becomes nearly uninhabited, as most of the population leaves along with their cattle.
Nearly in the center of Кунэль, Bézier is an immensely isolated village. The most notable thing about it is the small grail shrine at the northern end of the village.

Шыно was founded as one of a score of settlements in the Massif Orcal mountains and is the only one still remaining. The peasants here recently found a vein of high quality iron, which has afforded the hamlet much extra protection and vigilance from its protectors.

Жья is an old timber enterprise, founded long ago to provide building material for the Dukedom. With only the fools willing to even step foot near the forest of the fey, Кунэль sought out a new source of wood. Despite the dangers present in the Forest of Chalons, it is far safer to deal with the cloven ones than anger the elves.

On Мун-Дор, is the village of Мун-Дор. The silver mine here is far older than any current human settlement. The village was built here a few years ago, after the older settlement was razed by greenskins.

Castle Бомаршэ sits strategically between three important areas; Massif Orcal, the border with Парравун and the Loren forest. While Quenellian relations with the fey are… amicable, The Castle was built far enough from the border of the woods to prevent the wood elves interference with its walls such as at Castle Кунэль.

Founded by Shallyan cultists, Мэрсу Дэклу has grown as those seeking cures for their ailments have begun to settle around the monastery in thanks. These supplicants have built small homes and tilled the land, providing for everything the cultists here need.
At the foot of Massif Orcal, is the hamlet of Мунлак. Мунлак uses the terraces on the hills around them to grow line after line of grape vines, which are harvested for the tables of Nobles.
Сант Гудас is along the road that runs between Мэрсу Дэклу and Castle Кунэль. The people here long ago found a large deposit of clay.

Castle Carrad sits on the shore of the River Brienne near the border of Каркассон and the Forest of Loren. Its lord, Leofric Каррар, has inherited the fief in absentia. His father had given him permission to embark on his Grail Quest but as soon as Leofric left, his father grew gravely ill and passed into the arms of the Lady. Duke Tancred II has taken stewardship here until Leofric returns.

Nice is an old village, so old in fact that some Nobles suspect that the fey originally inhabited it. Despite this suspicion, the Fey have never disturbed the village, at least not in a manner particular compared to the normal demands and restrictions.
On the river Brienne, Лабеж sits mostly undisturbed by either invaders or their own lords. The people here are known for their cheese, which is commonly exported out of the Kingdom.
Along the road to Брыён is the village of Grasse, named for the tall grasses that grow in this region of Bretonnia. The people here raise notably large cattle on the grasses.
Castle Лагіе is both a castle and a major river port along the River Brienne. Nearby is the Grave of Cuileux, a Quenellian holy site where the founder of the Dukedom is entered.
On the river Brienne, sits the large farming village of Брусс. It was established by its lord as a plantation to grow flax for the industries in Кунэль.

Мунтодра is an isolated community, known only for their cultivation of cotton on the fertile plains north of Castle Лагіе. The village is remarkably close to the Grave of Cuileux, the people here are used to the sight of knights coming and going to pay their respects to the long dead hero.
Бордэруж is the last stop on the road before the Quenellian - Brionnian border. There is a tavern in the village, catering to traveling knights and merchants.

In the abyssal, death-ridden swamps formed by the slowing of the River Grismerie, Castle Музільён slowly descends into the boundless depths of Mousillon’s murky waters. Музільён itself thrives on barter and trade within the walls itself, many believe even more unsavoury acts happen deep within the city. Laden with dark lit taverns, unsavoury brothels, and dens of thieves, Музільён is a haven for the enemies of Bretonnia.

Located just north of Музільён, Les Marais Mort is hidden just beyond a vast number of hills, called Les Collines de Charnel. The village is barebones and infested with peasants afflicted by various mutations, many believe the origin to be long lost diseases emanating from Le Collines de Charnel.

Residing on the northern bank of the Grismerie river, the small settlement of Горж houses many humans and mutants alike. Being even poorer than most Bretonnian settlements, Горж stays afloat with communal fishing and what little they can scratch out of the ground. When they aren’t levied into their lord's armies.

La Grange, nicknamed “The Barn”, houses many steeds who would dare to graze into the foetid swamps of Музільён. Although a breeding ground for livestock, it is also popular for mutants and humans that need safe dwelling from the foul creatures of the night.

Across the border of Ліонэсс, Castle Рашар is lorded over by none other than Lord Рашар himself. Surprisingly, these lands are fairly established and well kept considering Mousillon’s hellish landscape and numerous dangers. Some adventurers and villagers say they hear noises coming from the castle, however no one has ever investigated the ongoing activities within the castle.

Not so much a village but more of a Tavern surrounded by makeshift homes, Лю Рузье Нуар is a small gathering hub for many unwanted vagrants and shifty wanderers. Indeed it is remarkable the small village houses mostly humans and not any mutants. The few houses surrounding the village are home to the manystaff at Лю Рузье Нуар.

A small hamlet that is isolated from most of Музільён itself, Ірэмі is home to a great number of humans, rather than mutants. Many of the peasants residing in the village work for Lord Aucassin and work in his kitchen at Chateau Хан. Ірэмі does get some trade because of its closeness to Grenouille Gate however.

Once the home of a valiant order of Knights known as the Order of the Blood Dragon, or the Ordo Draconis. One fateful night, a Vampire known as Walach Harkon challenged every Knight to single combat, eventually turning all who he deemed worthy into Vampires. The entirety of the Ordo Draconis was then wiped from existence and became known as the Blood Dragons.

It is from the King's Glade that Ariel and Orion preside over the realm of Athel Loren. They do not rule alone, but with the aid of a council. There are currently fifteen lords and ladies upon this council, drawn from the hidden realms that blossom beneath the trees. The King's Glade is a vast and awesome clearing, surrounded by great oak trees of immense girth and antiquity.Although vast, this city is virtually invisible to the untrained eye. It merges into the forest and is easily missed by idle traveller and foe alike. Over the centuries, Spellweavers created a city among the trees around the King's Glade. The branches of the great oaks were induced to entwine into walkways and canopies, galleries and vaults. Thus are the buildings and chambers made entirely of living trees, branches and foliage. Beneath the earth, the same methods have been used to create great hollows between the interwoven roots of the trees.

Тал Эт Айр is a woodelf settlement under the roof of the oak of ages. Forest spirits are very common in this area and interact a lot in the daily life of the Asrai. The village is surrounded by magical forest and is home to many shrines of the Asrai pantheon's.

The Asrai hall of Тал Куллон is small settlement east from Ін Эдрыл Койран and north of Tyr vanna. The region is filled with magic and has a high population of forest animals. Wild forest horses are numerous. The local elven population is really familiar with the horse herds roaming around. Every so often they bond with one of the horses and are able to ride them into battle.
The Asrai hall of Тал Говарн lies North of the oak of ages. The surrounding is one of the most fertile in Athel loren, it hosts many fields of wild fruit.

Wydrioth, the Pine Crags, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by the Glade Lord Фіндол and Lady Evelyne. It is an embattled region, ever beset by the Dwarfs and Greenskins of the Grey Mountains. the Pine Crags are in fact a sprawling fortress. Here, the Elves have shaped citadels and strongholds from skycrown oaks, and endless leagues of gnarled and tangled walls from rockbriar. A maze of walkways and root-braced tunnels bind the various outposts together into a single living defence-work capable of repelling a full-blown Attack.

The inhabitants of Тал Жыл-Фінэл are all combat experienced warriors for the've fought countless enemies coming from the grey mountains. The hall of Тал Жыл-Фінэл lies on the foot of the grey mountains. They are having numerous attacks on the forest from dwarves and greenskins whom try to lay waste to their beloved forest.

Тал Варыган is more often then not protecting it self from dwarven attacks. Dwarves try to destroy their forest and the inhabitants of Тал Варыган put every resource they have into killing the invading dwarves. Тал Варыган's main product is silver spoils of war they've got from the dwarven caravans and mines.

Atylwyth is eternally in winter, and it is rumored that its inhabitant's hearts are made of ice. The Forest Spirits of the Winterheart are always sluggish or asleep, so the safety of the realm has always depended heavily on the elves. There are more Eternal Guard in Atylwyth than any other realm. It is a realm locked in the icy embrace of winter; its boughs are ever covered in a thick rime of frost, its glades always heavy with snow. Pale statues line every path, and mark the entrance to every hall. Some of these works are exquisite ice sculptures, shaped by an artisan's patient touch. Others are frost-caged mischievous naiads or spiteful kelpies, imprisoned by Elven magics in punishment for past misdeeds or to prevent future ones. These statues flow and reform when the eye does not rest upon them, the creatures inside ever seeking to escape.

The hall of Тал Амер is a hall covered in ice. It contains large acient ice sculptures depciting the Asrai pantheon. Тал Амер is heavily guarded with Eternal guard for its spirits are asleep. Sometimes voices are heard from the ice sculptures does it contain the gods voices or do they serve another purpose?

The Trees of Тал Дрост are pillars covered in snow and ice. the ice forms a roof above the hall that keeps the elves dry from snowfall. protected by the ice barrier from above the Asrai found a way to plant vegetation and have a consistent food source in this snow covered land.

Constructed by lord Anaereth during the Season of Rebirth, the Halls of Aneareth are the seat of Lady Tevaril and Lady Delynna’s power. Mighty halls constructed under a great tree in the center of the Witherhold, the Halls have been fortified over the passage of time, especially since the corruption of Addaivoch.
Near the Балявальныя Залы Танца Вайны, the elves of Тал Хакан are often in a merry mood, either having just returned from the domain of Loec or are preparing to head that way again.

The halls of Brianda lay south of the Залы Анаэрэт. The hall serves as a outpost keeping a look out on Castle Quenelles. The Hall of Тал Брыанда hosts many waywatchers who are trained to scout the edges of Athel Loren.

A hall near the wild Heath, the empty wood and grasslands between Athel Loren proper and Bretonnia, Тал Валерын is used to its fair share of hardship. This region is particularly vulnerable to the cloven one’s incursions. Despite this, the elves here have no shortage in stubborn fortitude.
A hall near the Wysarian Ravine, Tal Rond serves as a watchout point, both against the forces that regularly gather around Addaivoch as well as nearby Parravon.

Fyr Darric, the Trickster's Wood, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lady Heggria of the Masque. Fyr Darric is the Elven god Loec the Trickster's holy ground within Athel Loren, the site of many shrines to his anarchic glory. Here too can be found the Балявальныя Залы Танца Вайны, the closest thing that the nomadic Wardancers of Athel Loren have to a home. As a result, the glades of Fyr Darric always resound to the sound of laughter.
Трэллок is a mighty tree who's echo's the songs and laughter of loec. Wardancers are often found near the tree laughing and dancing.

Modryn, the Night Glens is one of the twelve kingdoms of Athel Loren. It is ruled by Lady Morlanna and Lord Arlas. The thing that sets Modryn apart from all other realms of Athel Loren is the fact that it is eternally night there. When the Morathi poisoned Ariel's soul, the darkness spread through the forest. However, the rest of the forest recovered with Ariel, but Modryn has remained dark ever since. The elves of Modryn are as dark as their surroundings. They practice dark magic there that would be forbidden in other parts of the Athel Loren.

The hall of Тал Сторнас is a southern watch post made to repel Brettonian invaders from the dukedom of Carcasonne. No seconds chances are given for a captured human for dark sorcery will befall them as they enter Modryn.
Dark magic surrounds Талрэньнік for the Asrai living here are shrouded in darkness. Foreign wanderers coming close to Талрэньнік are never to be seen again.

Torgovann, also known as the Forge of Starlight is a realm in the Forest of Loren ruled by Lord Daith. Torgovann is the only area within Athel Loren where fire is a sacred symbol. Both a temple and a forge, Vaul's Anvil is used every night to forge weapons. The local Forest Spirits are drawn to the raging fire, but keep their distance, for they know it to be extremely dangerous.

The hall of Dovar is one of the biggest supplier of crude iron for lord Daith. Day and night Vaul's Anvil forges weapon. The never ending forge needs a never ending supply, for centuries the hall of Dovar has has given a answer to this call.

Cavaroc, the Skymark Reaches, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lord Edrael of Equos. It is the land of the meadow glades, the sparsely-wooded grassland plains that lie on Athel Loren's south border. The Elves of Cavaroc are horsemasters as fine as any in the world, and the first to march when the war-horns are sounded. They are swift to act, and swift to anger as well. it is all but a certainty that the Glade Riders of the Skymark Reaches will be found at the head of that mad charge.

The Asrai from Тал Амара are born riders. For generations they have delivered the most fierce Glade riders in Athel loren. The inhabitats of the hall of Тал Амара are swift to be angered and are not afraid to use violence as a solution.

Argwylon, or The Moonspring Glades is one of the twelve kingdoms of Athel Loren. It is ruled by Lord Thalandor Doomstar.The amount of magic in Argwylon far surpasses that of any other of the Forest's realms. Here, miracles and wonders are performed daily. This is one rare place in Athel Loren where records of history are kept, similar to those in Ulthuan. The elves here are also the only ones in Athel Loren that know the ancient tongue of the Eagles. However, Argwylon's elves are notoriously arrogant, and consider themselves superior to all other elves. It is a rare occurrence when an elf of another realm talks to an elf of Argwylon.
Локрымер lies between Тал Энда Варыан and the Waterfall palace of the Naiad Court. The tree serves as a outpost to watch Athel Lorens northern border.

The Naiad court is a place of light and wonder, where the rivers are alive with naiads, and the waterfalls sing with ghostly voices. The place has a natural defence system build with water, it has kept the spirits and elves that live here safe for ages.

Arranoc, also known as The Summerstrand is one of the twelve realms of Athel Loren. It is always summer in Arranoc, and in some parts night rarely falls. This causes the Forest Spirits in the Summerstrand to be especially strong. Arranoc is ruled by Amadri Ironbark, a former Wood Elf noble who later became a Tree Kin. Arranoc is under constant threat, because on its borders are the Vaults of Winter.

Летняе Дрэва is one of the biggest and most ancient trees of athel loren. It reaches sky high and absorb's it power from the sun. Many Asrai live under its roof were the shade protects them for the everlasting summer.

Anmyr, the Witherhold, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lady Tevaril and Lady Delynna. It is a realm in desperate decline. Many years ago, the foul Beastlord Morghur was slain in the heart of the region, and his blood corrupted the land for many leagues around. Ever since those days, the Wood Elves of Anmyr have been fighting a losing battle against Morghur's taint. Each year, the Beastmen warherds grow larger, increasing numbers of forest spirits are lost to madness and whole groves of trees wither and perish. In Athel Loren, the loss of even a single tree is a tragedy, so the ongoing legacy of Morghur's blood is cause for sorrow beyond words.

The Asrai hall of Тал Сілвох are filled with the most anarchic followers of the trickster god Loec. Every so often the nomadic wardancers appear to drink,dance, laugh and love... Only to dissapear the following morning and never to be seen again.

Cythral, the Wildwood, is a High Realm of Athel Loren, ruled by Lady Draya the Nighthawk. Not all the spirits of Athel Loren dwell in harmony with the Elves. Even now, thousands of years after the first great council, there are those beings who actively seek the Elves' destruction. Some revel in malevolence purely for its own sake, others would war against the Elves with all the cunning and might at their command, were they free to do so. It was to guard against this threat that the first Wood Elves planted a fence of waystones in the southeast of Athel Loren, creating the Wildwood — a prison for the most malevolent of forest spirits. Цір Ванна serves as the main stronghold of the Wildwood hosting a strong security and many look outs.
